basics.description: **Note:** _There may be [known issues](https://aka.ms/sentinelsolutionsknownissues) pertaining to this Solution, please refer to them before installing._ The [Cisco Umbrella](https://umbrella.cisco.com/) solution for Microsoft Sentinel enables you to ingest [Cisco Umbrella events](https://docs.umbrella.com/deployment-umbrella/docs/log-formats-and-versioning) stored in Amazon S3 into Microsoft Sentinel using the Amazon S3 REST API. **Underlying Microsoft Technologies used:** This solution takes a dependency on the following technologies, and some of these dependencies either may be in [Preview](https://azure.microsoft.com/support/legal/preview-supplemental-terms/) state or might result in additional ingestion or operational costs: a. [Azure Monitor HTTP Data Collector API](https://docs.microsoft.com/azure/azure-monitor/logs/data-collector-api) b. [Azure Functions](https://azure.microsoft.com/services/functions/#overview) **Data Connectors:** 1, **Parsers:** 1, **Workbooks:** 1, **Analytic Rules:** 10, **Hunting Queries:** 10, **Custom Azure Logic Apps Connectors:** 4, **Playbooks:** 4 [Learn more about Microsoft Sentinel](https://aka.ms/azuresentinel) | [Learn more about Solutions](https://aka.ms/azuresentinelsolutionsdoc)

options.text: This solution installs the data connector for ingesting Cisco Umbrella events stored in Amazon S3 into Microsoft Sentinel using the Amazon S3 REST API. After installing the solution, configure and enable this data connector by following guidance in Manage solution view.
The solution installs a parser that transforms ingested data. The transformed logs can be accessed using the Cisco_Umbrella Kusto Function alias.

link.label: Learn more about connecting data sources

options.text: This solution installs workbook(s) to help you gain insights into the telemetry collected in Microsoft Sentinel. After installing the solution, start using the workbook in Manage solution view.

elements.name: workbook1
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella

options.text: Gain insights into Cisco Umbrella activities, including the DNS, Proxy and Cloud Firewall data. Workbook shows general information along with threat landscape including categories, blocked destinations and URLs.
This solution installs the following analytic rule templates. After installing the solution, create and enable analytic rules in Manage solution view.

elements.name: analytic1
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Connection to non-corporate private network

options.text: IP addresses of broadband links that usually indicates users attempting to access their home network, for example for a remote session to a home computer.

elements.name: analytic2
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Connection to Unpopular Website Detected

options.text: Detects first connection to an unpopular website (possible malicious payload delivery).

elements.name: analytic3
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Crypto Miner User-Agent Detected

options.text: Detects suspicious user agent strings used by crypto miners in proxy logs.

elements.name: analytic4
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Empty User Agent Detected

options.text: Rule helps to detect empty and unusual user agent indicating web browsing activity by an unusual process other than a web browser.

elements.name: analytic5
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Hack Tool User-Agent Detected

options.text: Detects suspicious user agent strings used by known hack tools

elements.name: analytic6
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Windows PowerShell User-Agent Detected

options.text: Rule helps to detect Powershell user-agent activity by an unusual process other than a web browser.

elements.name: analytic7
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Rare User Agent Detected

options.text: Rule helps to detect a rare user-agents indicating web browsing activity by an unusual process other than a web browser.

elements.name: analytic8
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Request Allowed to harmful/malicious URI category

options.text: It is reccomended that these Categories shoud be blocked by policies because they provide harmful/malicious content..

elements.name: analytic9
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Request to blocklisted file type

options.text: Detects request to potentially harmful file types (.ps1, .bat, .vbs, etc.).

elements.name: analytic10
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - URI contains IP address

options.text: Malware can use IP address to communicate with C2.
This solution installs the following hunting queries. After installing the solution, run these hunting queries to hunt for threats in Manage solution view.

elements.name: huntingquery1
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Anomalous FQDNs for domain

options.text: Large number of FQDNs for domain may be indicator of suspicious domain.

elements.name: huntingquery2
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - 'Blocked' User-Agents.

options.text: Shows User-Agent values which requests were blocked

elements.name: huntingquery3
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - DNS Errors.

options.text: Shows error DNS requests.

elements.name: huntingquery4
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - DNS requests to unreliable categories.

options.text: Shows requests to URI categories which heavily are used in Initial Access stage by threat actiors and may contain malicious content.

elements.name: huntingquery5
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Higher values of count of the Same BytesIn size

options.text: Calculate the count of BytesIn per Source-Destination pair over 24 hours. Higher values may indicate beaconing.

elements.name: huntingquery6
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - High values of Uploaded Data

options.text: A normal user activity consists mostly of downloading data. Uploaded data is usually small unless there is a file/data upload to a website. Calculate the sum of BytesOut per Source-Destination pair over 12/24 hours.

elements.name: huntingquery7
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Possible connection to C2.

options.text: Calculate the count of BytesIn per Source-Destination pair over 12/24 hours. Higher values may indicate beaconing. C2 servers reply with the same data, making BytesIn value the same.

elements.name: huntingquery8
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Possible data exfiltration

options.text: A normal user activity consists mostly of downloading data. Uploaded data is usually small unless there is a file/data upload to a website. Calculate the sum of BytesOut per Source-Destination pair over 12/24 hours.

elements.name: huntingquery9
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Proxy 'Allowed' to unreliable categories.

options.text: Shows allowed requests to URI categories which heavily are used in Initial Access stage by threat actiors and may contain malicious content.

elements.name: huntingquery10
elements.label: Cisco Umbrella - Requests to uncategorized resources

options.text: Shows requests to URL where UrlCategory is not set.

This solution installs the Playbook templates to help implement your Security Orchestration, Automation and Response (SOAR) operations. After installing the solution, these will be deployed under Playbook Templates in the Automation blade in Microsoft Sentinel. They can be configured and managed from the Manage solution view in Content Hub.
